title: Rmd-options-vignette
text: Recommend output go html_document2 bookdown package (output: bookdown::html_document2). let auto-number cross-reference tables figures.

title: Rmd-options-vignette
text: several options control display Rmarkdown chunks output. detailed breakdown chunk options can found R Markdown Cookbook. echo: controls printing R code resulting HTML file. echo=TRUE code displayed output echo=FALSE code suppressed output. eval: controls whether chunk evaluated. eval=TRUE chunk run eval=FALSE chunk run. warning: controls printing warning messages. warning=TRUE warning messages displayed warning=FALSE warning messages suppressed. Recommend leaving warning=TRUE working project setting warning=FALSE final knit. message: controls printing messages. message=TRUE messages displayed message=FALSE messages suppressed. include: Setting include=FALSE allows evaluate chunk suppressing output (source code, warnings, message, text figure output).

title: Rmd-options-vignette
text: Creating hyperlinks: site resource want reference can create hyperlink instead formal Reference section. create hyperlink use following [word](URL). word become linked URL parentheses. Reference Section: multiple source need cite create formal references section. brief overview creating bibliographies citations can found R Markdown Cookbook.

what: Using the Chunk Options within the Template
title: Rmd-options-vignette
text: One goals CTSC Template easily create internal external version report. accomplish template internal variable set TRUE default. Use internal variable easily control chunks depending recipient output. asis chunks used additional text sections set echo=internal. control code chunks set include=interal eval=internal depending whether need chunk evaluated.

title: Tables-Figures-vignette
text: three packages recommend generating tables: kableExtra, arsenal, sjPlot. kable kableExtra package printing tables data frames. tableby arsenal package creating summary tables. tab_model sjPlot package creating HTML tables model results. currently aware two packages avoided table generation using template: table1 DT. tables result packages work auto-numbering cross-referencing functionality bookdown.

title: Tables-Figures-vignette
text: Use kable(data.frame) pipe data frame kable create table using kableExtra. cross-reference kableExrta table, reference chunk name (\@ref(tab:chunk-name)). example shown Table @ref(tab:kableextra-table). information using modifying tables kableExtra see vignette. Summary sepal length species.
code: iris |>   group_by(Species) |>   summarise("Mean (SD)" = paste0(round(mean(Sepal.Length), 3), " (",                                   round(sd(Sepal.Length), 3), ")"),             "Range" = paste0(round(min(Sepal.Length), 3), " - ",                               round(max(Sepal.Length), 3))) |>   t() |>   kable(caption = "Summary of sepal length by species.") |>   kable_styling()

title: Tables-Figures-vignette
text: Create summary table using arsenal::tableby. Make sure set chunk option results='asis' results look nice within report. cross-reference tableby object, reference chunk name (\@ref(tab:chunk-name)). example show Table @ref(tab:arsenal-table). information using tableby see vignette. Summary sepal lengths species. tableby vignette says add (\\#tab:table-label) beginning title order reference bookdown ’ve found causes table numbered twice, seen table @ref(tab:tableby-table). (#tab:tableby-table) Summary sepal lengths species.
code: summary(arsenal::tableby(Species ~ Sepal.Length, data = iris),         title = "Summary of sepal lengths by species.") summary(arsenal::tableby(Species ~ Sepal.Length, data = iris),         title = "(\\#tab:tableby-table) Summary of sepal lengths by species.")

title: Tables-Figures-vignette
text: tab_model function sjPlot package create HTML summary table model object. cross-reference tab_model table, add (\\#tab:table-label) beginning title. example shown Table @ref(tab:sjplot-table). information using tab_model see vignette. (#tab:sjplot-table) Results linear regression model.
code: sjPlot::tab_model(lm(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data = iris),                   title = "(\\#tab:sjplot-table) Results of linear regression model.")

title: Tables-Figures-vignette
text: writing aware figure packages avoided. figure chunk figure caption printed. kableExtra tableby tables, reference figures using chunk name (\@ref(fig:chunk-name)). Figure @ref(fig:example-fig) example. Boxplot sepal length species. tableby table, including (\\#fig:fig-label) beginning figure caption result double numbering, shown Figure @ref(fig:example-fig2). (#fig:example-fig2) Boxplot sepal length species.
code: ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_bw() ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_bw()

title: Template-vignette
text: CTSC Template provides skeleton project documentation report generation. template make easier follow reproducible research guidelines standardize output CTSC projects conducted using RStudio.

title: Template-vignette
text: Using template require create new folder. e.g. CTSC_0000_Investigator. Cache data file large. Cache analyses computationally intensive/time consuming. Document data processing steps analyses. Provide interpret results investigator. Using internal object setup chunk can controll display/suppression select sections. internal=TRUE show additional text/results internal documentation, internal=FALSE include sections send investigator.

title: Template-vignette
text: example CTSC project using iris data set.      Data appears normally distributed within species.
code: knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.width=12, fig.height=8,                       echo=TRUE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE)  # list default packages to load, add additional packages as necessary pacman::p_load(dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, kableExtra, knitr)  # update 'asis' chunk to allow inline code knit_engines$set(asis = function(options) {   if (options$echo && options$eval) knit_child(text = options$code) })   internal <- TRUE # source any external analysis scripts  # if analysis is computationally intensive there are a few options. #   1) run analysis and save all results to load here #   2) run analysis here and set chunk option cache=TRUE. A cached chunk will #      automatically load output and objects from a previous run. #         see https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown-cookbook/cache.html for more  #         information  # check distribution of measurements by group ggplot(iris, aes(sample = Petal.Length)) +   geom_qq() +   geom_qq_line() +   labs(title = 'Petal Length') +   facet_wrap(.~Species) +   theme_bw() ggplot(iris, aes(sample = Petal.Width)) +   geom_qq() +   geom_qq_line() +   labs(title = 'Petal Width') +   facet_wrap(.~Species) +   theme_bw() ggplot(iris, aes(sample = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_qq() +   geom_qq_line() +   labs(title = 'Sepal Length') +   facet_wrap(.~Species) +   theme_bw() ggplot(iris, aes(sample = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_qq() +   geom_qq_line() +   labs(title = 'Sepal Width') +   facet_wrap(.~Species) +   theme_bw() # displays R version, platform, base packages, attached packages, and packages # loaded via a namespace sessionInfo() #> R version 4.5.2 (2025-10-31) #> Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu #> Running under: Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS #>  #> Matrix products: default #> BLAS:   /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/openblas-pthread/libblas.so.3  #> LAPACK: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/openblas-pthread/libopenblasp-r0.3.26.so;  LAPACK version 3.12.0 #>  #> locale: #>  [1] LC_CTYPE=C.UTF-8       LC_NUMERIC=C           LC_TIME=C.UTF-8        #>  [4] LC_COLLATE=C.UTF-8     LC_MONETARY=C.UTF-8    LC_MESSAGES=C.UTF-8    #>  [7] LC_PAPER=C.UTF-8       LC_NAME=C              LC_ADDRESS=C           #> [10] LC_TELEPHONE=C         LC_MEASUREMENT=C.UTF-8 LC_IDENTIFICATION=C    #>  #> time zone: UTC #> tzcode source: system (glibc) #>  #> attached base packages: #> [1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base      #>  #> other attached packages: #> [1] knitr_1.51       kableExtra_1.4.0 ggplot2_4.0.1    tidyr_1.3.2      #> [5] dplyr_1.1.4      #>  #> loaded via a namespace (and not attached): #>  [1] gtable_0.3.6       jsonlite_2.0.0     compiler_4.5.2     tidyselect_1.2.1   #>  [5] xml2_1.5.1         stringr_1.6.0      jquerylib_0.1.4    systemfonts_1.3.1  #>  [9] scales_1.4.0       textshaping_1.0.4  yaml_2.3.12        fastmap_1.2.0      #> [13] R6_2.6.1           labeling_0.4.3     generics_0.1.4     tibble_3.3.0       #> [17] bookdown_0.46      desc_1.4.3         svglite_2.2.2      bslib_0.9.0        #> [21] pillar_1.11.1      RColorBrewer_1.1-3 rlang_1.1.6        stringi_1.8.7      #> [25] cachem_1.1.0       xfun_0.55          fs_1.6.6           sass_0.4.10        #> [29] S7_0.2.1           viridisLite_0.4.2  cli_3.6.5          withr_3.0.2        #> [33] pkgdown_2.2.0      magrittr_2.0.4     digest_0.6.39      grid_4.5.2         #> [37] rstudioapi_0.17.1  lifecycle_1.0.4    vctrs_0.6.5        evaluate_1.0.5     #> [41] glue_1.8.0         farver_2.1.2       ragg_1.5.0         pacman_0.5.1       #> [45] rmarkdown_2.30     purrr_1.2.0        tools_4.5.2        pkgconfig_2.0.3    #> [49] htmltools_0.5.9

title: Template-vignette
text: study brief analysis iris data set. Aim 1: Provide example ctsc_template_short. Aim 2: Investigate species differences petal dimensions. Aim 3: Investigate species differences sepal dimensions.

title: Template-vignette
text: data processing done analysis.

title: Template-vignette
text: Calculate summary statistics sepal length, sepal width, petal length, petal width species. Test group differences.

title: Template-vignette
text: group means provided Table @ref(tab:table-demo-kable) Table @ref(tab:table-demo-arsenal). shown Table @ref(tab:table-demo-arsenal), sepal petal measurements different groups, p < 0.001. quick look Figure @ref(fig:figure-demo) shows setosa petal length, petal width, sepal width likely significantly different virginica. Sepal length likely significantly different setosa veriscolor. information Rmd options please see Rmd-options-vignette. information Tables Figures please see Tables-Figures-vignette. Summary Sepal Petal Lengths Widths Species Results Species Linear Model ANOVA Demo Figure Caption
code: # demo table by piping data into kable() iris |>   group_by(Species) |>   summarize(Sepal_Length = paste0(round(mean(Sepal.Length), 2), " \u00B1 ",                                    round(sd(Sepal.Length), 2)),             Sepal_Width = paste0(round(mean(Sepal.Width), 2), " \u00B1 ",                                   round(sd(Sepal.Width), 2)),             Petal_Length = paste0(round(mean(Petal.Length), 2), " \u00B1 ",                                    round(sd(Petal.Length), 2)),             Petal_Width = paste0(round(mean(Petal.Width), 2), " \u00B1 ",                                    round(sd(Petal.Width), 2))) |>   kable(caption = "Summary of Sepal and Petal Lengths and Widths by Species",         col.names = c("Species", "Sepal Length", "Sepal Width", "Petal Length", "Petal Width")) |>   kable_styling() summary(arsenal::tableby(Species ~ Sepal.Length + Sepal.Width + Petal.Length +                            Petal.Width, data = iris,                           numeric.stats = c('meansd', 'Nmiss')),          pfootnote = TRUE, title = 'Results by Species') iris |>   pivot_longer(cols = c(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length,                          Petal.Width),                values_to = "Measurements", names_to = "Part") |>   ggplot(aes(x = Part, y = Measurements, color = Species)) +   geom_boxplot() +    labs(y = "Length or Width (cm)", x = "Plant Part") +   theme_bw()

title: Create a new Quarto Document from Template — new_quarto
Create a new Quarto Document from Template — new_quarto
text: filename Character string. name file without '.qmd' extension. letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores allowed. path Character string. Directory file created. Defaults current project's base directory. gist Character string. Qmd template file create/open.
